content.question: Which of the following series can be used with the limit comparison test to determine whether the series <math alttext="the sum, from n equals 1, to infinity of, the fraction with numerator 5 plus, 2 times the square root of n, and denominator n cubed, plus, 3 times n squared, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><munderover><mo>∑</mo><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><msqrt><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><msup><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math> converges or diverges?

choices.label: <math alttext="the sum, from n equals 1, to infinity of, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator the square root of n, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><munderover><mo>∑</mo><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the sum, from n equals 1, to infinity of, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator n squared, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><munderover><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the sum, from n equals 1, to infinity of, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator n raised to the five halves power, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><munderover><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the sum, from n equals 1, to infinity of, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator n cubed, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><munderover><mo>∑</mo><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the sum, from n equals 1, to infinity of, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator n raised to the five halves power, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><munderover><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
